title: Update README.md
body: Previous description seems a bit confusing as it suggests always using const. I'm guessing that's a result of literal translation of document from "var" in ES5

title: "Bad option: 'esversion'." issue
body:
I'm using the jshint presets of this repo with `"esversion": 6` option. But when I run grunt jshint job, it always throw "Bad option: 'esversion'." error which I don't know how to fix.

Did someone face this problem also?

title: cannot override object-shorthand
body:
I can't seem to disable this rule...

here is my .estlintrc file:

```
{
    "parser": "babel-eslint",
    "plugins": [
        "react"
    ],
    "env": {
        "node": true,
        "browser": true
    },
    "parserOptions": {
        "ecmaFeatures": {
            "jsx": true,
            "modules": true
        }
    },

    "extends": "airbnb",

    "rules": {
        comma-spacing: 2,
        new-cap: 2,
        object-shorthand: 0,
        one-var: [2, never],
        quotes: [1, single],
        space-before-blocks: 2,
        //react
        jsx-quotes: [2, prefer-double],
        react/jsx-curly-spacing: 2,
        react/jsx-max-props-per-line: [2, {maximum: 4}],
        react/jsx-no-duplicate-props: 2,
        react/jsx-no-undef: 2,
        react/jsx-indent: 0,
        react/jsx-indent-props: 0,
        semi: ["error", "always"],
        "indent": ["error", "tab", {"SwitchCase": 1}],
    }
```

But I still get:

> error    Expected method shorthand

title: Batman suggestion superman PLEASE thank you
body: https://github.com/airbnb/javascript/pull/931

title: Change Batman to Superman
body: Not sure if this is how to do this.  Please reconsider.  Superman is much better fit for this style guide.  I beg you merge.

title: Constant conditions in generators
body:
Currently eslint warns user if constant condition like `while (true) {}` is used, which is pretty understandable most of the times. Although it could be really useful when used inside of generators, for example in sagas. 

I think generators should be an exception to this rule?

title: Update README.md
body: fix good switch

title: Minor typo: "coxcomb graph" v/s "coxcomb chart"
body: The "bad" and "good" diffs in section 19.2 ("Additional trailing comma ") had different text; making them the same to avoid confusion about what the difference is.

title: Array with objects
where did the wiki go?
body: there's a link in the readme to a "style guide guide" which purportedly exists in the wiki (which doesn't exist). what's the intent here?

title: fix defaults for import/no-extraneous-dependencies
body: These should both [default to true](https://github.com/benmosher/eslint-plugin-import/blob/master/docs/rules/no-extraneous-dependencies.md). The rule is disabled so this doesn't really matter, but if you override it with `'import/no-extraneous-dependencies': 2`, now you'll get the expected defaults.

title: Consider to add rule that using .find() when selector with id in jQuery
Update README.md
body: Airbnb style guide used (and loved) by StratoDem Analytics

title: Remove parens around single argument in React example
body:
Parens around a single argument aren't in line with the [javascript guide](https://github.com/airbnb/javascript/blob/0814be638f22b01a8e49efd77094be24055a3d48/README.md#arrows--one-arg-parens):

> If your function takes a single argument and doesn’t use braces, omit the parentheses.

title: Link to Japanese Translation for readme
body: Japanese Translation for readme file.

title: Configuration for rule "prefer-arrow-callback" is invalid: Value "[object Object]" has more items than allowed.
body:
I'm running the eslinter in atom, and whenever I make a change or save a js file I'm getting the following error:

> Error: C:\Users\chardie\Documents\Repos\spa-admin\node_modules\eslint-config-airbnb-base\rules\es6.js: Configuration for rule "prefer-arrow-callback" is invalid: Value "[object Object]" has more items than allowed.
> 
> Referenced from: C:\Users\chardie\Documents\Repos\spa-admin\node_modules\eslint-config-airbnb-base\index.js Referenced from: airbnb Referenced from: C:\Users\chardie\Documents\Repos\spa-admin.eslintrc
> Error: C:\Users\chardie\Documents\Repos\spa-admin\node_modules\eslint-config-airbnb-base\rules\es6.js:
>   Configuration for rule "prefer-arrow-callback" is invalid:
>   Value "[object Object]" has more items than allowed.
> Referenced from: C:\Users\chardie\Documents\Repos\spa-admin\node_modules\eslint-config-airbnb-base\index.js
> Referenced from: airbnb
> Referenced from: C:\Users\chardie\Documents\Repos\spa-admin.eslintrc
>     at validateRuleOptions (C:\Users\chardie\Documents\Repos\spa-admin\node_modules\eslint\lib\config\config-validator.js:118:15)
>     at C:\Users\chardie\Documents\Repos\spa-admin\node_modules\eslint\lib\config\config-validator.js:165:13
>     at Array.forEach (native)
>     at Object.validate (C:\Users\chardie\Documents\Repos\spa-admin\node_modules\eslint\lib\config\config-validator.js:164:35)
>     at load (C:\Users\chardie\Documents\Repos\spa-admin\node_modules\eslint\lib\config\config-file.js:520:19)
>     at C:\Users\chardie\Documents\Repos\spa-admin\node_modules\eslint\lib\config\config-file.js:388:36
>     at Array.reduceRight (native)
>     at applyExtends (C:\Users\chardie\Documents\Repos\spa-admin\node_modules\eslint\lib\config\config-file.js:365:28)
>     at load (C:\Users\chardie\Documents\Repos\spa-admin\node_modules\eslint\lib\config\config-file.js:527:22)
>     at C:\Users\chardie\Documents\Repos\spa-admin\node_modules\eslint\lib\config\config-file.js:388:36

I saw this issue was discussed in https://github.com/airbnb/javascript/issues/897, and the suggested resolution was to uninstall the global eslint binary. I tried that, unfortunately it didn't work for me. Please let me know if you require further detail.

title: Elaborated and turned off rules
body:
Soryy, I've just started to use `eslint-config-airbnb-base` and rules as this puzzle me:

https://github.com/airbnb/javascript/blob/master/packages/eslint-config-airbnb-base/rules/best-practices.js#L117-L122

What's the point in elaborating the rule parameters if the rule itself is turned off?

Is this all about [this merging scheme](https://github.com/eslint/eslint/issues/6361), so that, if a user just turns the rule on, all the recommended parameters would be ready?

title: linting rule for https://github.com/airbnb/javascript#naming--filename-matches-export
body: Is there any linting rule available for https://github.com/airbnb/javascript#naming--filename-matches-export?
